It forced Knicks brass to ship young center Willy Hernangomez to Charlotte at the trade deadline. “Fans play a big part — their opinion matters,'' O'Quinn said. “At the end of the day, coach's decision trumps everybody. context_meta.title: Warriors could tell the NBA commissioner all about the fine art of tanking
context_meta.summary: NBA commissioner Adam Silver put on his bad cop hat this week, fining Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban $600,000 for speaking the plain truth and admonishing the Association's 30 franchises that tanking “has no place in our game.” Commissioners are so cute when they're sanctimonious. The subject came up when Cuban said during a podcast that he told his players “losing is our best option.” Why? Because the worse your record, the better chance you have of getting the first pick in the draft. Mind you, there is no evidence that the Mavs are throwing games, and plenty of evidence that they are simply a collection of mediocre players. It hasn't always been that clear cut. But enough about the Warriors

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: How the Utah Jazz survived - and thrived
context_meta.summary: At NBA All-Star weekend, Jazz rookie Donovan Mitchell talks about staying humble while he continues to exceed expectations early in his career. There is no NBA handbook for this sort of thing. A star player leaves a small market team that built everything around him, and years of planning and progress are instantly in peril because of one free agency choice. Just ask the Cleveland Cavaliers in 2010, when LeBron James took his talents to Miami. Or the Oklahoma City Thunder in 2016, when Kevin Durant left for the Golden State Warriors. The big city franchises have a way of recovering from losses like these, but there's nothing more devastating for the underdog organizations than seeing a centerpiece

context_meta.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers continued their strong second half of the season with a 131-113 win over the Miami Heat on Thursday. Isaiah Thomas scored a season-high 29 points to help lead the Lakers (27-34) to their fourth straight victory since the All-Star break. Lonzo Ball finished with eight points, seven assists, six rebounds and six steals in his first start since Jan. 13. The Heat (32-30) remain in the eighth spot in the Eastern Conference. Ball had missed more than a month with a knee injury. He had played two games prior to Thursday, coming off the bench in each. context_meta.title: CEO of gunmaker that produced Florida shooter's weapon: 'I share nation's grief'
context_meta.summary: American Outdoor Brands’ profit fell sharply over the three months ending 31 January, it reported. James Debney, the British-born chief executive of the company that made the rifle used by the gunman in the school shooting in Florida last month, on Thursday said he “shared the nation’s grief” over the massacre. Announcing American Outdoor Brands’ (AOB) latest results, Debney called the shooting, which killed 17 at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas high school in Parkland, an “incomprehensible loss of life” but said the company would continue to support the right of Americans to carry firearms.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: What we learned in the Warriors 109-101 win over the Wizards
context_meta.summary: The Warriors wanted to come back from the NBA's All-Star break playing some of their best basketball of the season, and four games into the “second half” of the campaign, it seems as if the Warriors are doing just that. Golden State is now 4-0 since the All-Stat break after beating the John Wallless Washington Wizards 109-101 Wednesday night in the nation's capital. Kevin Durant led the way with 32 points on 60 percent shooting, and the Warriors saw solid performances from Klay Thompson (despite a poor start shooting), Draymond Green, and Andre Iguodala. Golden State will play the Hawks in Atlanta on Friday. They'll then have the weekend and Monday off before playing the Nets on Tuesday in Oakland.

Cruz's gunshots couldn't break through the window because it's made of hurricane-proof glass, the official said. Robert Runcie, the Broward County Public Schools superintendent, said in an interview today with ABC News' Victor Oquendo that bullets were fired "through the window" on the third-floor of the freshman building.

context_meta.title: Tesco and Booker shareholders give marriage blessing
context_meta.summary: Tesco's 4 billion pound takeover of Booker was overwhelmingly backed by shareholders of both companies on Wednesday, clearing the final hurdles to the creation of a new powerhouse in Britain's 200 billion pounds-a-year food market. Investor approval, which followed the regulatory green light in December, means the cash and shares deal to combine Tesco, Britain's biggest retailer, with Booker, the country's largest wholesaler, is set to complete on March 5. The support is a personal victory for Tesco Chief Executive Dave Lewis, who stunned the market in January 2017 with an agreed deal with Booker that was originally valued at 3.7 billion pounds.

All while the Celtics were lighting up the scoreboard, Aron Baynes was quietly enjoying one of his most brilliant, under-the-radar performances of the season. As Boston's offensive stars were busy piling up the points, Baynes was busy bodying up against Dwight Howard - one of the most challenging one-on-one tasks a big man can face in the NBA. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Heat's Dwyane Wade Hits Game-Winner vs. 76ers
context_meta.summary: Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade entered "Father Prime" mode late in Tuesday's contest against the Philadelphia 76ers at AmericanAirlines Arena. With under nine seconds remaining and the Heat trailing 101-100, Wade found himself matched against Philadelphia's Ben Simmons near the top of the key.  The three-time champion sunk a long two-pointer over Simmons' outstretched arm to give the hosts a one-point advantage with 5.9 seconds on the clock.  76ers guard JJ Redick missed an open three-pointer as time expired, and the Heat held on for the thrilling victory.
